title: Brilliant PSG demolish Inter Milan 5-0 to win first Champions League title
summary: Inter were simply no match for the French club, who recorded the biggest victory by any team in the final in the 70-year history of the European Cup and Champions League. PSG also became the first team to score five goals in the final since Benfica in 1962.

title: Paris erupts with flares and fireworks, the Eiffel Tower lit up in red and blue after PSG's Champions League title
summary: Toward the end of the blowout 5-0 match against Inter Milan, a total of 81 arrests had already been made. 'Let's celebrate but without breaking everything in Paris,' PSG forward Ousmane Dembélé told local news following the historical win.

title: Police have to hold back PSG fans as they try to rush the field after Champions League win
summary: At the final whistle, police lined up in front of the PSG end of Munich's Allianz Arena stadium, but struggled to contain the fans for several minutes when they came down from the stands following the trophy presentation. Paris Saint-Germain lifted the trophy for the first time after beating Inter Milan 5-0 on Saturday.

title: UK anti-obesity legislation falls victim to food industry lobbying
summary: Keir Starmer's Labour government announced the delay of new, stricter rules limiting advertising for 'ultra-processed' foods.

title: Hamas says it responded to US truce proposal and will free 10 living hostages
summary: Hamas said it responded to the US's proposal of a truce, which would last for 60 days, according to sources close to the negotiations.

title: Macron calls for 'coalition of independents' amid increasing threats from China and the US
summary: Invited to deliver the keynote speech at the Shangri-La Dialogue, a defense and security forum for Asia, the French president condemned the 'whims' and 'greed' of the two great powers, once again advocating for a 'third way.' His American counterpart warned Beijing against invading Taiwan.

title: Thousands march in Rome against security clampdown law
summary: A new security law passed by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni increases sentences for certain acts including protests and strengthens protections for police officers accused of violence.

title: France charges 25 suspects in crypto abduction cases
summary: The Paris public prosecutor said 18 people were placed in pre-trial detention on Saturday after a spate of kidnappings, successful and attempted, related to those in the crypto world.

title: The 14 miracle lightning strike survivors, united by the bolt that spared their lives
summary: The 14 people who survived being simultaneously struck by lightning in eastern France on September 2, 2017, remain a close-knit group and a valuable sample for scientific research.

title: Paris: Holocaust memorial and three synagogues targeted by green paint overnight
summary: The police reported damage to four locations in the 4th arrondissement, with no messages or claims of responsibility found. 'We will press charges,' said Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo in a statement released to the press.

title: Meta joins the race to develop augmented reality for the US military, alongside Anduril
summary: Mark Zuckerberg has once again partnered with Palmer Luckey, who designs equipment for the US military. The creator of the Oculus virtual reality headset, an early supporter of Donald Trump, left Facebook in 2017 amid controversy.

title: Etienne-Emile Baulieu, inventor of the abortion pill, dies aged 98
summary: World-renowned for developing, in 1982, a medical abortion method that revolutionized the lives of millions of women worldwide, the committed physician and researcher died in Paris on May 30 at the age of 98.

title: Luis Enrique, the architect of PSG's transformation
summary: With his uncompromising temperament, the coach has taken full control at the Parisian club, which is playing in the Champions League final against Inter Milan on Saturday, in Munich, Germany.

title: In Poland, the grip of the anti-European far right weighs on the presidential election
summary: Ultraconservative and populist parties unexpected surge in the first round of the Polish presidential election on May 18, especially among young voters, revealed a waning of the traditional polarization in Polish political life.

title: How artists dress: A work of art in itself
summary: The Louvre-Lens Museum is shining a spotlight on the clothing styles of painters, visual artists and sculptors through July. From Rosa Bonheur's blue smock to Joseph Beuys's uniform, it is a topic rarely explored.

title: Czech justice minister resigns after accepting €40 million in bitcoin from convicted criminal
summary: Czech Justice Minister Pavel Blazek has stepped down following a scandal over the sale of bitcoins donated by a criminal convicted of drug trafficking.

title: Israel launches unprecedented verbal escalation against Macron
summary: The Israeli government has launched an offensive against the French president following his remarks on recognizing a Palestinian state and Israel's blockade of humanitarian aid to Gaza.

title: Businesses left in the dark by uncertainty around US tariffs
summary: Within 24 hours, Donald Trump's tariffs were ruled illegal and then reinstated on appeal. These twists and turns have made the work of negotiators and businesses impossible.

title: What is France's 'Black code' and why hasn't it been repealed?
summary: The 'Code noir,' enacted in 1685 under King Louis XIV, defined the rules of slavery in France's colonies. Prime Minister François Bayrou has promised to finally repeal it.
